onFinishInflate().Description: Finalize inflating a view from XML. This is called as the last phase of inflation, after all child views have been added. Even if the subclass overrides onFinishInflate, they should always be sure to call the super method, so that we get called. If you override this method you must call through to the superclass implementation.
onFinishInflate().history: Added in API level 1 Deprecated in API level 17

Returns: A handle to the item with ID text2.

getAccessibilityClassName().Description: Return the class name of this object to be used for accessibility purposes. Subclasses should only override this if they are implementing something that should be seen as a completely new class of view when used by accessibility, unrelated to the class it is deriving from. This is used to fill in @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityNodeInfo#setClassName_E@.
getAccessibilityClassName().history: Added in API level 23 Deprecated in API level 17

ClassDesc: This class can be implemented easily by apps using a @B_android#widget#RelativeLayout_E@ or a @B_android#widget#LinearLayout_E@. A view group with two children, intended for use in ListViews. This item has two @B_android#widget#TextView_E@ elements (or subclasses) with the ID values @B_android#R#id#text1_E@ and @B_android#R#id#text2_E@. There is an optional third View element with the ID @B_android#R#id#selectedIcon_E@, which can be any View subclass (though it is typically a graphic View, such as @B_android#widget#ImageView_E@) that can be displayed when a TwoLineListItem has focus. Android supplies a @B_android#R#layout#two_line_list_item_E@ (which does not include a selected item icon), but you can design your own custom XML layout for this object.
